website_summaries.verdict: A beginner-friendly camera flash compatible with most DSLR cameras with a hot shoe connection.
pros: Camera flash offers all of the most common modes and settings for a basic, affordable accessory
Can be used as a slave flash for use with off-camera shooting
Swivels for off-axis shooting as well
cons: Camera flash warms up quickly, eventually shutting down if not allowed to cool off

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Great value - any review has to keep in mind the super low price. Pros: Optical trigger, low price Cons: No zoom, not even push/pull. the guide number is VERY low. This flash has about as much reach as a pop up flash but unlike the pop up you can swivel it or use as a slave.
customer_reviews.author: MagarityTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: incredible value!
customer_reviews.text: Let's put it this way: I spent more on lunch today than I did on this flash. For the money, there is nothing remotely close to this thing. The construction is solid, it has nice features (like flash intensity) and unlike some other brands, the manual is coherent. I really love the swivel flash head (side to side and up and down). I may buy another to use as a slave. Yes, it requires batteries, but at this price, who cares? BTW, I use mine with a Canon 5D Mark II.
customer_reviews.author: alienintheheights

customer_reviews.title: The flash unit exploded.
customer_reviews.text: Another example of getting what you paid for. Within two minutes of turning it on I heard a loud pop from inside the flash followed by a buzzing sound.Then liquid started leaking out of the battery compartment. At first I thought a battery (fresh RayOvacs) had exploded. Removing the batteries, they all looked intact with no signs of physical damage. I later confirmed they were all good with a volt meter. What really happened was evident. One of the internal electrolytic capacitors, possibly the one storing the charge for the flash, had exploded and leaked electrolyte. Absolutely cannot recommend this product. Returned for credit.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: A great value flash
customer_reviews.text: This flash gets the job done well. Very adjustable and does well with battery drain. It WILL NOT trigger any screen adjustment/illumination on your viewfinder so be aware that shots in low light will come out significantly lighter than what you see on on the display before taking the picture. As a macro photographer this makes taking pictures with tiny aperture difficult but I work around it by leaving the pop up flash on my sony a6000 open and facing up. The picture attached was taken on a cloudy day with aperture all the way down to 12. Impressive and nice light i.m.o
customer_reviews.author: Owen T Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, durable, professional results.
customer_reviews.text: This flash actually produce better results than the built in flash. Plus you can get creative and really make your photos pop. It will help you create professional quality results with very little effort. This is a must have for portrait photography. Your gonna love the results and your subjects will love how it accentuates there best features. Everyone who sees the results are surprised how it improves their appearance. Step up to the next level. Go for It. I am very happy with the results. Now I'm the person people call when they want their image captured. What next? Fashion Photography.
customer_reviews.author: Larry RobinsonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good Flash which doesn't cost you an arm and a leg!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product. My present Camera is Pentax K-3ii. This one comes without built-in flash and I wanted to buy an external flash for occasional use. The good thing is it is about 1/3rd the cost of lowest costing Pentax I saw on Amazon. The only thing which I didn't like is the lid/cap of the battery compartment, rest is good and it will last at least 2 summers. Check out this flash in action on youtube. Just search for this model number on youtube!
customer_reviews.author: 1DoctorGenius

customer_reviews.title: Works Great- You need GOOD batteries. Not knock-offs.
customer_reviews.text: This would have been perfect for me,as a novice photo dude, if it held together. But with very few uses it already froze up on me and I'm returning for a refund. I would normally just replace it and try again but this is my only flash. So I'm putting some extra funds into a higher quality flash. Seems like a memory malfunction, of sorts. Price and simplicity are the pro's. ***UPDATE*** Turns out that even though the batteries worked initially, those type were 'too cheap' for the flash; even new. Replaced with DURACELL and it worked again and I haven't had a problem since. I'm very happy because this was inexpensive and did exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: dr.hubato!

customer_reviews.title: Really amazing price. Tilts and swivles
customer_reviews.text: You cant beat the value, and it works as expected. Really amazing price. Tilts and swivles. However, being new to external flashes, I didn't understand that some flashes will work the the "TTL" functionality of your camera (Through T/he Lens exposure control) and others won't. This one won't, unsurprisingly given the insanely low price, which means you have to take the photo, manually adjust exposure/flash output, then repeat until you get something you like. But the light output is very good, it has a small built-in diffuser as well as a white card to direct some flash forward if you have the unit poinitng up
customer_reviews.author: Jon from Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Buy This Flash
customer_reviews.text: WOW - Fantastic! Finally found a simple, basic, manual flash and the price is unbelievable - I had very low expectations. I couldn't believe it has a built-in optic slave with two separate settings. If you need a flash to think for you, then go spend a bunch of money, but if you know how to shoot with manual controls, this flash is an amazing value. I had been searching for something that would work like the old Vivitar 285 - this flash does four times as much at one-third the price. I'm loving the AmazonBasics line. Pleasantly surprised so far.
customer_reviews.author: lbdoe3

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, surprising price!
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed by the capability and battery life of this flash. I was shooting multiple frames per second on my Canon Rebel EOS digital camera in "Sports" mode the other day. I must've shot 120 pictures in 30 seconds and this flash fired on time every time. Pound for pound for your dollar, you cannot go wrong with this amazing gem if you are on a budget. The flash mounts right up, no issues, has a nice multidirectional swivel, excellent battery life, and to be honest, outperformed the Nikon that I was replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Shane

customer_reviews.title: Great Manual Flash
customer_reviews.text: been using this for awhile in a studio setup with a 24" softbox. Using 125 shutter speed it measures out to F4 , 100 iso from 6 feet at 1/4 power. I use two when shooting, flashes are low powered enough to recharge immediately usually 1/32 at real ranges. Have had no problems in six months use.
customer_reviews.author: Terry W. Overton Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Good interface, remembers settings between power cycles
customer_reviews.text: Good interface, remembers settings between power cycles, bright discharge and fast cycle time. That said, I can only get the flash-triggered slave mode to work in very dark settings or at very close range, and not most real-world situations. So there's still a need for an RF system or flash cables with these units. And since I bought these so I could avoid using my RF units for routine work, that's a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase good for close up still and night shots ...
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase good for close up still and night shots light adjusts nicely i have been asked by at least 30 different friends and people if it works better then a led diff-user i said yes it adjusts better but that is just my very own opinion tho on that one.. Also where i got this flash and have had 15 friends also purchase one for the price some just getting into photography and some that are pros so this is a win or lose for this price I tried it for price and am glad I tried it out i honestly like it takes A A batteries or you can get sum nice rechargeable ones choice is all yours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works so far
customer_reviews.text: I am using this with a Nikon D3500, and so far it seems to be working well. The camera itself is so light that the flash is awkward when mounted, but that can't really be helped. I have not had any issues using this as a slave flash. I use a little homemade reflector on the built-in flash to direct that flash away from the subject, and that triggers the AmazonBasics flash pointed at the ceiling. Pictures have turned out well.
customer_reviews.author: jm

customer_reviews.title: BEST FLASH I'VE USED!
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not... the best flashes I've used! The only thing I wish I could adjust the 'head' down when set up on the stand... and don't leave it on!! It will drain the batteries. You'll find out that it isn't flashing because you left it on from the night before. Just replace the battery and there you go. Also, it automatically synced with my DSLR without configuration. I wasn't expecting that.
customer_reviews.author: JeMble

customer_reviews.title: If I could give this zero stars I would!
customer_reviews.text: The listing implies that this is will work with a Canon DSLR automatically; it doesn’t. It’s a 100 % manual flash; at least with the one that I received. BTW, I’m a retired degreed photojournalist; I know my stuff. This flash is a piece of junk. A current Vivitar flash from Walmart works better than this does and it’s the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne W. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: I am very Please.
customer_reviews.text: Jul, 30th, 2019 As a photographer, I give credit where credit is due. I can't believe this Amazon basic camera flash was gone to have so much power in it, sofar I don't regret that I Invested in this little basic flash, I feel very confident with it. And I wanted people to know that I'm not getting paid to tell the truth, I advise some of my friend's to try it them self and they agree with me. Thank You Amazon for that little flash, I am a very satisfied costumer with your basic product amazon. God Bless To Amazon, and To All The Staffs Members. Sincerely Yours: Mr. C. Menard
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flash bulb exploded after 18 months, no longer usable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item on 5/30/2018 and it is now 12/11/2019 and today the flash bulb exploded while doing a family portrait session. With that said, this glad worked just fine up until now. It’s a pretty basic glad unit and easy to use but the build quality is just ok. Definitely not professional grade but still pretty decent quality for a starter flash. I am pretty disappointed to say that the flash is has already bit the bullet after only a year and 1/2. I guess that just goes to show that you do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Van Veldhuizen

customer_reviews.title: MUCH Better Than Expected.
customer_reviews.text: So far, these flashes have been GREAT for tabletop macrophotography. When I first got into serious studio macrophotography, I had the Yongnuo YN560s recommended to me. Those have a reputation, and not a good one. They're also more than three times the price of these Amazon flashes. Not only have they been reliable, they can take a beating. Until mounted on t-track, the magic arms holding these had a tendency to rotate, dropping them onto the table. They continue to work like a champ. I had the Yongnuos recommended to me as "throw-aways"... for three times the money. These flashes are keepers at "throw-away" prices.
customer_reviews.author: DeanimatorTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Optical Trigger Does Not Work Outside
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a really nice, inexpensive flash. I have returned it, however, because the optical trigger does not work outside and that was my sole reason for purchasing this flash. I have a point-and-shoot camera without a hot shoe for which I need off-camera flash, hence RF triggers are out of the question. The optical trigger on this unit always worked inside up to at least 20 feet. It never worked outside even once. In the shade, overcast day, the camera flash 2 inches from the sensor - didn't matter. This flash will not trigger outside.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Reeser

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: This flash does not work on the Canon 77D as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: R. P.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Causes burns
customer_reviews.text: Bought this flash for a photo booth event for Santa at a military base. After about 2 dozen flashes, the unit stopped working, thinking it drained the batteries, went to replace them. The batteries were SO hot I could not grab them with my bare hands. Took a thermal temperature reading, the batteries were over 150 degrees Fahrenheit. Be EXTREMELY careful, and do not use this flash as a primary flash. Not sure if it would be better with an AC adapter or not.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Albright II

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.text: This product was insanely difficult to figure out. If you don’t have the plastic piece on the top pushed in all the way, the flash will not go off. When shooting next to other photographers I learned that this flash at full power is just about at level 2 on theirs. My camera (canon rebel t6i) also doesn’t read as the flash going off when it does. (I noticed this posting my photos on Flickr so if that doesn’t matter to you than oh well) I definitely wouldn’t buy this one again but it was ok for a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Ayla combs

customer_reviews.title: Basic is a good description
customer_reviews.text: This is a good bare bones manual flash. It’s really best for off camera work, or work where the correct exposure can be determined and set. If the light to subject distance is constantly changing you might want something a bit more ‘auto’ capable. For off camera work these can be good supplemental lights due to their optical trigger capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: 111t

customer_reviews.title: Excellent basic flash!
customer_reviews.text: This is just a basic flash, that has got the power to make you photo blind for minutes even, when the flash is bounced at the typical height of roof (Roughly 10 feet ). It has got the flash power control buttons, button for 3 modes (M, S1, S2) and test button. When in slave mode it has ability to fire automatically without use of triggers. For the list features what you get is the worth what you pay for. Recycle time is decent. Pros: Build quality Power of flash Ability to use as slave without triggers Cons: No zoom functionality. Everything is manual. (No TTL) No sync cable in the box.
customer_reviews.author: karthik meduri

customer_reviews.title: Great value, basic and reliable speedlight
customer_reviews.text: This little speedlight has been perfect for portrait photography and event photos. Does all the basic functions you need from a flash, with a price to match. Battery life isn't that great, but easily solved by using rechargeable batteries. Paired with a Pentax K5 and some reflectors, it works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: PNWFox

customer_reviews.title: Great flash
customer_reviews.text: I finally got to really use this flash on a location shoot and for a product shoot and I am very happy with how my photos turned out. Yes it's basic and yes you have to manually change the flash power but it's still quick and easy and it works better than my $300 flash I buy with my camera years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Videographer/Photographer

customer_reviews.title: ... hobby or profession so you’re constantly looking for the best value for price
customer_reviews.text: When it comes down to photography everybody knows that is an extremely expensive hobby or profession so you’re constantly looking for the best value for price, this flash for me as an amateur photographer has been excellent and I highly recommend it for anyone even professional photographers some of my photographer friends don’t like the fact that it uses AA batteries, but in my case I bought rechargeable batteries from Amazon So it’s not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Haruka-J

customer_reviews.title: Great basic flash
customer_reviews.text: Great basic flash. Use this flash and learn how to use flash in manual mode. No reason to spend a couple hundred dollars. Provides good fill light for a great price. I purchased two and use them for portrait shots. Usual setup is one as a back fill light and the other as a indirect fill light
customer_reviews.author: Tim S

customer_reviews.title: Devourer of Batteries
customer_reviews.text: This came with the camera I bought my boyfriend for Christmas. On first inspection and use of the item, we found it to be quite nicely made and fully functional. Though it does take some time to figure out how to use it. Definitely needs patience to use it and is not a beginner item. Our biggest issue is the battery life on it. It consumes batteries fast and can only sustain power for a couple hours of use before needing a fresh set of batteries. Going to try rechargables on it to refrain from having to constantly buy new batteries to sacrifice to its ferocious appetite.
customer_reviews.author: NightChild

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Basics keeps winning my money
customer_reviews.text: I was quite impressed with build quality of the flash unit. It fit to my hot shoe on my Nikon 7200 like a glove and sync'ed to the camera right away. The flash unit has a wide range of brightness and has a built in diffuser that pulls down. I am not a professional photographer by any means but this certainly helps my portrait work and opens my low light options.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to my expensive Canon flash
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to just try a speed light because I’m new to photography and needed a better flash option. My dad let me borrow his expensive Canon speed light and honesty there really isn’t much of a difference. They both produced the same result. I found this Amazon one to be a bit easier to get the hang of as a newbie. If you’re just starting out in photography this is a great piece to start out with as you’re learning!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great budget flashes!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a professional photographer and needed to get some quick inexpensive flashes after my Nikon speed-light died. I photograph using fully manual flash and camera settings (even with high end speed-lights) so a fully manual flash is no problem for me. I’ve bought two for less than half what the repair of my Nikon speed-light costs and so far have photographed four weddings with them and no issues so far. Will they last as long as a Nikon or Cannon - probably not. But if you’re in need of some inexpensive flashes these might just do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope

customer_reviews.title: Why Pay More?
customer_reviews.text: I am not generally one to buy off brand electronics. I have two Canon dslrs and figured I needed a Canon flash to round things out. However, after enjoying the two Alexas and lots of Amazon brand batteries and iPhone cords I have bought, I figured Amazon earned a chance. It is a relatively simple and uncomplicated flash that works well and was reasonable priced. I am not Herb Ritts or Ansel Adams so I don’t need much. And for what I do need this works perfectly
customer_reviews.author: G. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Falling Apart after 6 Months!
customer_reviews.text: After barely six months of irregular use (mostly light testing at home and maybe once or twice for actual very low impact amateur photography), this thing is already falling apart. I wanted to test it out as a slave flash (will be shooting my company group portrait), and when I dropped a fresh set of batteries in, one of the contacts just dropped out. Just like that, it's rendered non-operational. Will stick to my name brands (have Nikon, Sony, and Canon DSLRs and speedlights) from this point on.
customer_reviews.author: Randoir

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for the price, died after 17 months
customer_reviews.text: For the 17 months that the flash lasted, it was a great bargain. It swivels smoothly in all the expected ways, and provides reasonable coverage with a 35mm lens on a full-frame DSLR (some light fall-off at the corners, but nothing that can't be dodged away). As far as I could tell, the stated guide number was correct; it's not the most powerful flash, but good for most reasonable situations. It's not made of particularly durable-feeling plastic, and after 17 months, the tube seems to have gone bad: the control LEDs light up, but no flash.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Don't think just get it!
customer_reviews.text: So it doesn't rotate all the way to the right to 180 but who cares? Primary use for this is using this on a trigger whether it's a kicker light or against a white wall/ceiling... or through a softbox/bare. it does the job. It's also a lot faster manipulating the power when you're doing manual flash. The battery pack connector is helpful too. All shooters should have at least 1 of these.
customer_reviews.author: FT

customer_reviews.title: Budget Minded and effective.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap but effective. I would buy two if you plan to use these professionally, just in case (per other reviews its good to have multiples) and the price is right. You will need to buy batteries to put in the device. The hot shoe fits very well and I would buy this again and recommend it to friends!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: All settings have to be made manually on the flash, it does not communicate with the camera. It is also not very bright compared to other flashes. I was using it with a Nikon D7000. I do not recommend this flash, others in this price range are better.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy with the performance of this flash. The no frills flash works great for my product photography using a 24” softbox. Pros: same power output as my other flash. Don’t let the guide number fool you. The flash head doesn’t zoom so it’s equivalent to my other flash at 24mm. Cons: the color temperature is a little bit bluer at 5800k than other flashes making mixed lighting conditions challenging (I custome white balanced for my product shots, so no issue there)
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Too big for MFT, poor build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Priced for what it's worth. OK as a slave in "studio" situation. Not OK to carry around with MFT. After a week one of the springs that maintains battery contact broke off. I'll take a one time replacement. If this one expires early, I'm done with AmazonBasics. 2 days after the return period expired, the unit failed to fire. New batteries, different mode, different power don't make a difference. POC.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not have focus assist, otherwise an awesome value.
customer_reviews.text: I sent this unit back thinking it was defective because it would not focus assist in low light only to realize it does not have that function. You need to get a ttl flash for that feature. As far as flashes go its performs great for the price. I would have still returned it because I need low light focus for what I tend to shoot. All other functions performed well hence the 4 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen McG

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, affordable battery
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a camera for work and needed and external flash, but didn't want to pay a lot. When it arrived, I was actually impressed that it was of higher quality than I expected. You can easily adjust the strength of the flash on the flash device itself, is very user friendly and seems sturdy. Looking forward to really test driving it this week!
customer_reviews.author: Harvey187

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sturdy flash for cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Very well built for a flash this cheap! Super quiet (no whine) and fast recharge. Love the manual intensity settings. Head tilts and swivels 180 degrees and has a built in bounce card. The only negative is that it is a large/bulky flash, which for me and taking outdoor photos, becomes a burden to haul around. Still, a great deal!
customer_reviews.author: T. Mackey

customer_reviews.title: but I do not use the smart or dedicated settings
customer_reviews.text: I have a "smart" flash, which I use, that cost me 5 times as much, but I do not use the smart or dedicated settings.(not accurate enough with bounce set ups). I only use the full power to 1/128th power settings on my smart flash but the amazon flash controls are much easier to use. This flash can be also be used as a slave unit in either smart or manual flash triggering and it has a built in white flash bounce card to boot. You can use it on different camera brands since it only has one connecting point.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo C.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these. Tested two and neither works properly. The Slave wireless sync does not fire the flash unless right on top of sensor. HUGE disappointment. Now I have to order radio triggers to make these function properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a great budget flash the only downside is the flash sync ...
customer_reviews.text: a great budget flash the only downside is the flash sync is measured in bars of varying heights rather then shutter speed or ISO steps hell you could do both on the top and bottom of the bars works FLAWLESSLY with my NIKON D3200
customer_reviews.author: Philip Marquis

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working properly after warranty period.
customer_reviews.text: Used only once or twice while new. Left it alone for awhile After warranty period it stopped working. Won't work with any of my cameras now. Useless waste of money. Buy it only if you need it to work with certainty for 30 days so you can return it otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: ahs77

customer_reviews.title: Decent Economical Flash
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good flash for the price, and does work well. It's not complicated and works well with my Canon DSLR. It also it's too big, so it fits in my camera bag nicely alongside my zoom lens. Great flash for the value!
customer_reviews.author: Swiss American

customer_reviews.title: Battery contact plate DOESNT WORK
customer_reviews.text: I’m incredibly disappointed in a product that was so raved about. When I insert batteries, the unit will not close not matter how hard I try. I bought this a month ago and finally had the chance to use it, and now I can’t even use it at all. A complete waste of $30. I’m looking into returning this item. **I used energizer batteries, AA.
customer_reviews.author: momto4girlz

customer_reviews.title: for the price has a product better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This flash is a pleasant surprise, for the price has a product better than expected, has a short recharge time, allowing several shots in one minute, is very easy to use as a secondary flash that helps to illuminate situations Light effects or to achieve effects on photos with models or objects. I made a good purchase with him and I think I will buy a pair more to complete my portable light kit.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Malespin

customer_reviews.title: Really cool
customer_reviews.text: This is my first accessory for my Canon EOS Rebel T6 and I'm really impressed with the quality build. Does not feel cheap in my hands and the instructions that it came with helps a little bit but hey... I'm just a novice .....so far. The flash intensity is amazing, makes the room look like daytime in a disk environment. Down side is the 4 AA batteries required to work the flash and I'm only giving 3 stars until I know how the batteries last for but hey, it works great. Now it's time to look for a lens and an external mic.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Ryskiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Optical sensors do not work well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these for off-camera fill flash to be triggered by their optical sensors for use in residential interior photography. The sensors do not always pick up the main flash and fire. They will fire approximately sixty percent of the time despite being carefully positioned for proper exposure to the key flash. I will look for a more expensive flash with a more sensitive and reliable optical sensor. Sorry I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good Flash for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: My initial review is that for the money this is a great flash unit. Keep in mind this is not a fully automatic unit, and it does not have TTL. With that said: I shoot only in manual and adjusting the flash settings is no bother to me. I would recommend this flash to anyone who is on a budget who wants a quality unit.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Stonewall

customer_reviews.title: Not for professional use!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a pro photgrapher and used this flash unit as a slave attached to a wireless tiger unit. On a family photo shoot. The batteries became so hot that they burnt my hand and the flash unit was so hot you literally couldn't touch it. I was very upset! I switched out with fresh batteries and the unit started working as normal again only for a bit until it became hot again and then just stopped working! It now smells like melted plastic and will not power up!
customer_reviews.author: Piperdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Stop now, move on.
customer_reviews.text: Spend an extra $10 on a VK750. It will save you time and frustration. I returned this item because it would not work with my Eneloop rechargeable batteries, the slave was real iffy and it started to malfunction after a few hours (double flashes). For a few bucks more you can do much better.
customer_reviews.author: pb

customer_reviews.title: Good optical slave flash (no wireless)
customer_reviews.text: This can be stand alone flash attached to the camera directly. But the beauty of it is for optical slave flash. It uses optical receiver to trigger flash, so you need to have the master flash to trigger it. Since it is optical receiver, it can be triggered by ANY flash onsite, including the flash from your small compact camera!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: build quality is good enough for me & what I use it for
customer_reviews.text: I just receive this 3 days ago & have been playing with it -- testing & comparing with the Altura TTL Flash I bought 3 years ago. I took a chance based on some very positive reviews on YouTube. As one YouTube reviewer said, "It just works! And you can't beat the price!) I totally agree! Being a Manual Flash has not proven difficult. It's powerful, build quality is good enough for me & what I use it for. I love the Optical Triggering Feature! Get One -- to learn about flash photography and/or as a backup for your TTL flash.
customer_reviews.author: DPD

customer_reviews.title: Nice manual flash unit.
customer_reviews.text: I've used it on two cameras, my Canon PowerShot G16 and my Panasonic Lumix G7. It works with either camera and does so quite well, especially with the Panasonic. This manual flash has already taught me one thing: I'd rather have a TTL flash. :)
customer_reviews.author: mLo68

customer_reviews.title: Modern battery technology would be nice.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great value, but I really wish it had a lithium ion of LiFe battery in it with a slow self-discharge rate. After sitting on the shelf for a few weeks or more, the batteries are too low to get more than a few flashes, if any, out of this. Also, the ability to charge the battery(ies) without removing them would be nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Nekobasu

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Near identical to the another manual flash that I have, which cost $50. Build quality is similar and fine, but there are small differences, for example the pc connector and diffuser are slightly more flimsy. Power, flash color and recharge times are the same as well. The optical trigger works well. It stores the power level per mode (m, s1, s2).
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Lights on the back just blink
customer_reviews.text: I have had this flash for less than a year, i have barely used it and all the lights on the back of the flash start blinking when I turn it on. I have to wait like 30 seconds for them to stop blinking. The flash is not usable while the lights are blinking. Turning off then back on again doesn't work. Its very annoying. Anyone else have this problem?
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two this year, one works and the other recently purchased flashed once, popped and stopped working. Based on the other reviews I'll have to look for something a little better. Really disappointed as I needed the two. Can't return cause I'm back in the Caribbean. Guess this one was a bad apple.
customer_reviews.author: Junior Patterson

customer_reviews.title: It did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I tried this because I always wanted a flash to go with my Canon Ti1. I don't know why, but it did not work. I used new batteries twice, but could not get it to work with the camera. I did not try a replacement though to see if the one I received was a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Battery door is messed up on both units i bought
customer_reviews.text: They are a fight to close the battery door. other than that they do what they should ok. they get to hot faster than others and wont fire but that's a spaceflight issue.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Poe

customer_reviews.title: Poor flash connection
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought the Neewer TT560. The Amazon flash has an out of date flash sync connection, which is not mentioned in the product description. Seems like a $4.00 cheaper version of the Neewer, but with poorer remote flash connection.
customer_reviews.author: G1SFO

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: While the flash has no TTL capability, it's a fantastic value. The flash is more than powerful enough for any room I have been in while pointed at the ceiling, and seems decently built.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wisniewski

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible product. I only used it once where it actually worked, but after trying to use it again, I will not work nor connect to my camera. I don't understand why, but I will not be purchasing another one. Not worth buying, because it messed up during the times I was trying to do a photoshoot. NOT GREAT and very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Shakeia Smith

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with Nikon
customer_reviews.text: I shoot with a Nikon camera and broke my light flash. I ordered this one for a photo shoot it arrived in a timely manner. I like the fact that I can adjust the brightness as well as how large of a flash I need. Definitely a win for me. Way to go Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Graham

customer_reviews.title: Good basic flash and the price makes it even better.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this flash a lot since it arrived. The variability between low flash level and highest setting is quite surprising. For the price this is a great flash. The build quality seems to be good, I was expecting a cheaper feeling flash for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Turner.

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive flash
customer_reviews.text: Very basic, but wanted an inexpensive flash for off camera use. I use in manual, and my pocket wizards trigger the flashes, so it's a perfect & simple flash for ocf. I plan to buy a few more of these for use wile traveling, as well as for back-up. Also works quite well on camera on both my nikon d4s and fuji xt2.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Doyle

customer_reviews.title: A nice flash which broke too soon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this flash over an year ago and have used it since then. I am a occasional photographer so flash is used probably 2-3 times in month. It is a nice flash and worked fine and up to my expected use. A month ago when I was putting the batteries, the lid of battery compartment cracked. Couple of weeks ago it broke and came off. So now the flash is not usable any more.
customer_reviews.author: Shashank Hambarde

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Canon Speedlite and am now experimenting with off camera flash but on a budget and the 'Electronic Flash', from AmazonBasics fit my purposes perfectly. I have a couple and have found them easy to set up and they have worked splendidly.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Oterson

customer_reviews.title: It works for what I need it to do, ...
customer_reviews.text: It works for what I need it to do, which is give me some fill flash for outdoor portraits that are backlit. I don't shoot portraits for money or weddings. No TTL is not a big deal for me. I set the camera to M after finding my settings in Av mode, throw the ISO on 100 and start with 1/4 down power and try a few shots until I find the one that works.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong with this price
customer_reviews.text: Works just as good as my other & $300 flash. Wish I wouldn’t purchases this one first and saved myself the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: This flash would stay frozen in start up mode and wouldn’t work. Returned it. OLD: I really like this flash. My pictures have come out so much better with this indoors. I highly recommend. I love pointing at the ceiling and having it look so natural
customer_reviews.author: Suhey C

customer_reviews.title: I was never able to use this.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about this flash but it never did connect or communicate with my Cannon DSLR. I thought I was doing something wrong I even asked experts to help with settings but indeed it was the flash all along. It may work for you, it did not work for me. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, basic, manual flash.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these and they work well for me. I've moved on to using more powerful, radio triggered flashes but I still use these units to light backdrops and as rimlights using the optical slave. I'm considering buying two more units to help blow out white backgrounds better, I could buy three of these for the price of a manual radio triggered flash.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Okuna

customer_reviews.title: “The flame that burns Twice as bright burns half as long.”
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: The price is right. Nice, bright flash. Con's: Short lifespan. Cheap plastic. Bought this flash about six months ago. Tonight it finally died on me. I got some good uses out of it up until now. I suspect it died due to overheating (extensive use on my part, this evening). I noticed a crack forming on the battery door last week. Now, I'm on the hunt for something that will hopefully offer some overheating protection and last me longer than six months.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Fannon

customer_reviews.title: Came in handy
customer_reviews.text: This flash was awesome for a first purchase of an external flash. It was helpful when taking pictures of twins who are one month old because I was able to point the flash at the ceiling or nearby wall instead of in their eyes. I am not satisfied with how wiggly the flash is on my Canon T4i. This is my first flash, so I'm not sure if all flashes are like this or not.
customer_reviews.author: Kim P.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for first flash
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised, the optical sensor works great even when the on-camera flash is bounced on a wall. It's lightweight and works perfect with my D3200. This would be a great cheap option for your first flash. Keep in mind that this is a manual flash, so it lacks TTL.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for professional is as an optical slave.
customer_reviews.text: It will not flash consistently as an optical slave. This is not for professional use. It works fine otherwise. Get a $50 and above flash if you need it for professional use.
customer_reviews.author: W. C. Atwater

customer_reviews.title: Great strobist flash
customer_reviews.text: Very basic flash but works perfectly for additional light in a scene. Highly recommended for strobists.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Mohatarem

customer_reviews.title: Very good and affordable flash for your camera.
customer_reviews.text: Works well with Rebel T3i. Just snap on and you done. I would highly recommend this product for beginners and experienced photographers. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Victoriya Erdneeva

customer_reviews.title: No Power
customer_reviews.text: This flash might as well have no further power reductions beyond 1/2 Appears to have reasonably good quality construction. Especially for 27 bucks. Would recommend something with more juice.
customer_reviews.author: Anon220

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had saved up for a better flash...
customer_reviews.text: Works well as an on camera flash. It will not sync as an external flash. I've tried both slave modes and I have to be slightly in front of the flash and close for it to flash at all, but it does not flash when it is suppose to.
customer_reviews.author: JPax

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave this a 5 star, but now have changed to a 1 star due to the flash only working intermittently. I hope this is a fluke and that I will be able to return/exchange it and see if another flash is operational.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: These work very well for the price. They have ...
customer_reviews.text: These work very well for the price. They have features many more expensive flash units don't have. They are not as well made as my Nikon SB800 flash unit, but it didn't cost me $400.00 either.
customer_reviews.author: westevenssr

customer_reviews.title: more than I expected !
customer_reviews.text: Nice flash, more than I expected. thought it would be very basic however it is quite a nice unit
customer_reviews.author: mark a. capsalors

customer_reviews.title: Iffy When You Need It
customer_reviews.text: I love the flash when it decides to work. Ive put it onto my camera multiple times but its iffy when it comes on. Sometimes I'll have to sit and tamper with the flash to get it to work..
customer_reviews.author: Modie Cotton

customer_reviews.title: If I buy a better unit with metering
customer_reviews.text: This flash does everything as advertised. If I buy a better unit with metering, this one could still be a handy secondary unit. Also, if you haven't used a flash unit in a while, you'll be impressed at how fast this refreshes as I was.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. A

customer_reviews.title: Good flash but requires four AA batteries
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a stop gap to give me a better flash option for work. Although it may not look as fancy, it gets the work done with its variable flash levels and the option to be able to trigger it from a distance. My only dissatisfaction is that it requires four AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Firestorm

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: 2 of 3 died after limited use. Garbage Chinese product. Buyer beware these are not to be depended on for any real photography.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Garsha

customer_reviews.title: Works for EOS R
customer_reviews.text: It's better than the built in flash. Used it on my 70D for 2 years. Now on my EOS R!
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: OVERALL, I CAN SAY, NOT BAB
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I can say NOT BAD. It's not a top flight speedlite, but it gets the job done. In fact, I dot two of them. So, it can't be all taht bad, right?
customer_reviews.author: EDDIE DID IT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Price on a quality Flash!
customer_reviews.text: This flash is very nice! At this price you can't go wrong purchasing this flash. I've completed my flash set up at a very good price thanks to these flashes here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: You wouldn't thing that a $27 fish would work so well, you'd be wrong. I'm using several of these with flash triggers when I do small studio work. Good power output, batteries (rechargeable Energizers) have lasted through 2+ hour shoots.
customer_reviews.author: David Hill

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: i need it immediately for a wedding and it did OK for the most part. The settings can be very back words and complicated but for the price point, it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Quality is low
customer_reviews.text: The flash worked well at first, but stopped working after a short period of time
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Flash only worked once
customer_reviews.text: For some reason I can't figure, the flash only worked once the first time I put batteries, but I have not been able to use again since. It won't even power on (lights only flash for a moment). I've tried replacing with new batteries without luck.
customer_reviews.author: Ben M

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Electronic Flash for DSLR Cameras (Canon, Nikon)
feature_bullets: External flash for taking professional-looking photos in low-light conditions; compatible with Canon and Nikon DSLR cameras
3 flash modes for versatility: M, S1, S2 (Manual mode, Slave mode 1, and Slave mode 2)
Standard PC synchronous port (input) for off-camera connecting; wireless sensor for triggering flash from a distance
Tilts up to 90 degrees; rotates up to 270 degrees
8 levels of flash-brightness control; automatic saving function retains current flash settings; hot shoe stand and carrying bag included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars995 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
